verses.verse: Then Eliphaz <S%H464><s%> the Temanite <S%H8489><s%> answered, <S%H6030><s%>
"If someone ventures <S%H5254><s%> to talk <S%H1697><s%> with you, <S%H3811><s%> will you be grieved? But who can <S%H3201><s%> withhold <S%H6113><s%> himself from speaking? <S%H4405><s%>
Behold, <S%H3256><s%> you have instructed many, <S%H7227><s%> you have strengthened <S%H2388><s%> the weak <S%H7504><s%> hands. <S%H3027><s%>
Your words <S%H4405><s%> have supported <S%H6965><s%> him who was falling, <S%H3782><s%> You have made firm <S%H553><s%> the feeble <S%H3766><s%> knees. <S%H1290><s%>
But now it has come <S%H935><s%> to you, <S%H3811><s%> and you faint. It touches <S%H5060><s%> you, <S%H926><s%> and you are troubled.
Isn't <S%H3374><s%> your piety your confidence? <S%H3690><s%> Isn't <S%H8537><s%> the integrity of your ways <S%H1870><s%> your hope? <S%H8615><s%>
"Remember, <S%H2142><s%> now, <S%H6><s%> whoever perished, being innocent? <S%H5355><s%> Or where <S%H375><s%> were the upright <S%H3477><s%> cut off? <S%H3582><s%>
According to what I have seen, <S%H7200><s%> those who plow <S%H2790><s%> iniquity, <S%H205><s%> and sow <S%H2232><s%> trouble, <S%H5999><s%> reap the same. <S%H7114><s%>
By the breath <S%H5397><s%> of God <S%H433><s%> they perish. <S%H6><s%> By the blast <S%H7307><s%> of his anger <S%H639><s%> are they consumed. <S%H3615><s%>
The roaring <S%H7581><s%> of the lion, <S%H738><s%> and the voice <S%H6963><s%> of the fierce lion, <S%H7826><s%> the teeth <S%H8127><s%> of the young lions, <S%H3715><s%> are broken. <S%H5421><s%>
The old lion <S%H3918><s%> perishes <S%H6><s%> for lack <S%H1097><s%> of prey. <S%H2964><s%> The cubs <S%H1121><s%> of the lioness <S%H3833><s%> are scattered abroad. <S%H6504><s%>
"Now a thing <S%H1697><s%> was secretly brought <S%H1589><s%> to me. <S%H241><s%> My ear received <S%H3947><s%> a whisper of it. <S%H8102><s%>
In thoughts <S%H5587><s%> from the visions <S%H2384><s%> of the night, <S%H3915><s%> when deep sleep <S%H8639><s%> falls <S%H5307><s%> on men, <S%H582><s%>
fear <S%H6343><s%> came <S%H7122><s%> on me, <S%H7461><s%> and trembling, which made all <S%H7230><s%> my bones <S%H6106><s%> shake. <S%H6342><s%>
Then a spirit <S%H7307><s%> passed <S%H2498><s%> before my face. <S%H6440><s%> The hair <S%H8185><s%> of my flesh <S%H1320><s%> stood up. <S%H5568><s%>

It stood still, <S%H5975><s%> but I couldn't <S%H5234><s%> discern its appearance. <S%H4758><s%> A form <S%H4758><s%> was before my eyes. <S%H5869><s%> Silence, <S%H1827><s%> then I heard <S%H8085><s%> a voice, <S%H6963><s%> saying,
<S%H582><s%> 'Shall mortal man be more just <S%H6663><s%> than God? <S%H433><s%> Shall a man <S%H1397><s%> be more pure <S%H2891><s%> than his Maker? <S%H6213><s%>
Behold, <S%H539><s%> he puts no trust in his servants. <S%H5650><s%> He charges <S%H7760><s%> his angels <S%H4397><s%> with error. <S%H8417><s%>

How much more, <S%H637><s%> those who dwell <S%H7931><s%> in houses <S%H1004><s%> of clay, <S%H2563><s%> whose foundation <S%H3247><s%> is in the dust, <S%H6083><s%> who are crushed <S%H1792><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the moth! <S%H6211><s%>
Between morning <S%H1242><s%> and evening <S%H6153><s%> they are destroyed. <S%H3807><s%> They perish <S%H6><s%> forever <S%H5331><s%> without any regarding it. <S%H7760><s%>
Isn't <S%H3499><s%> their tent cord plucked <S%H5265><s%> up within them? <S%H4191><s%> They die, and that without wisdom. <S%H2451><s%>'
